author: Zusha Elinson
title: Police Scrutinize YouTube Shooter’s Social Media for Motive
text:
SAN BRUNO, Calif.—Nasim Najafi Aghdam, who is accused of shooting three people inside YouTube’s headquarters before killing herself on Tuesday, was angry at the company for allegedly censoring her video content and making it more difficult for her to make money.
The San Bruno Police Department has identified Ms. Aghdam, 39, as the shooter and said Wednesday that Ms. Aghdam’s bitterness toward YouTube appears to have motivated the attack.
... RELATED VIDEO YouTube Shooter's Video Complaining of Unfair Treatment Nasim Najafi Aghdam, accused of shooting three people inside YouTube's headquarters in San Bruno, Calif., posted this video to her personal website in January, complaining of unfair treatment by the company.
